description: Wrexham scored an injury time winner to pip Swansea City to a top four finish after phase one of the Adran Premier.
title: Late winner sees Wrexham pip Swansea to top four finish
title_page: Late winner sees Wrexham pip Swansea to top four finish - BBC Sport
maintext:
Wrexham scored an injury time winner to pip Swansea City to a top four finish after phase one of the Adran Premier.
The rearranged fixture looked to be heading for a 2-2 draw which would have been enough for the Swans to join Cardiff City, The New Saints and Briton Ferry Llansawel in the Championship Conference.
But Keren Allen struck in the 90th minute to send Wrexham through at their expense.
Swansea will now join Barry Town, Aberystwyth Town and Cardiff Met in the Plate Conference.
Ava Suckley and Maisie Miller had exchanged goals in Llandarcy before Abbie Iddenden gave the visitors a half-time lead. Katy Hosford brought the Swans back level before Allen's late winner.
League leaders Cardiff City were also in action on Wednesday night, with first half goals from Ffion Price and Mackenzie Olden enough to see off Aberystwyth Town in their 2-0 win.
